ids.description: Array of UUID strings or string with comma-separated UUID strings

aspect_ratio.description: The aspect ratio of the image

image_end_url.description: The URL for the end of the image

image_url.description: The URL of the main image

user_prompt.description: The user-provided prompt for image generation
user_prompt.example: A beautiful sunset over the ocean

prompt.description: A non-empty string up to 512 UTF-16 code points in length. This should describe in detail what should appear in the output.

image_url.description: A HTTPS URL or data URI containing an encoded image to be used as the first frame of the generated

last_image_url.description: A HTTPS URL or data URI containing an encoded image to be used as the last frame of the generated

duration.description: The number of seconds of duration for the output video

ratio.description: The aspect ratio of the generated video

seed.description: If unspecified, a random number is chosen. Varying the seed integer is a way to get different results for the same other request parameters. Using the same seed integer for an identical request will produce similar results

watermark.description: A boolean indicating whether or not the output video will contain a Runway watermark.

video.description: If the status is success, this will contain an array of strings. Each string will be a URL that returns an output from the task. URLs expire within 24-48 hours.

prompt_optimizer.description:
The model will automatically optimize the incoming prompt to improve the generation quality If necessary.
For more precise control, this parameter can be set to False, and the model will follow the instructions more strictly. At this time
It is recommended to provide finer prompts for best results.

first_frame_image.description:
The model will use the image passed in this parameter as the first frame to generate a video. 
        Supported formats:
        - URL of the image
        - base64 encoding of the image
        Image specifications:
        - format must be JPG, JPEG, or PNG;
        - aspect ratio should be greater than 2:5 and less than 5:2; the shorter side must exceed 300 pixels
        - file size must not exceed 20MB.

url.description: The URL you get to download the video

prompt.description: The text prompt to guide video generation.
prompt.example: Mona Lisa puts on glasses with her hands

negative_prompt.description: The negative prompt to use. Use it to address details that you don't want in the image. This could be colors, objects, scenery and even the small details (e.g. moustache, blurry, low resolution).

seed.description: Random seed for reproducibility. If None, a random seed is chosen.

aspect_ratio.description: Aspect ratio of the generated video (16:9 or 9:16).

inference_steps.description: Number of inference steps for sampling. Higher values give better quality but take longer.

guidance_scale.description: Classifier-free guidance scale. Controls prompt adherence / creativity.

shift.description: Noise schedule shift parameter. Affects temporal dynamics.

sampler.description: The sampler to use for generation.

enable_safety_checker.description: If set to true, the safety checker will be enabled.

prompt.description: The text prompt describing how the image should be animated

image_url.description: URL of the input image to animate. Should be 720p or higher resolution

aspect_ratio.description: The aspect ratio of the generated video

duration.description: The duration of the generated video in seconds. Possible values: 5, 6, 7, 8

prompt.description: The text prompt describing the video you want to generate

aspect_ratio.description: The aspect ratio of the generated video

duration.description: The duration of the generated video in seconds. Possible values: 5, 6, 7, 8

seconds_start.description: The start point of the audio clip to generate

seconds_total.description: The duration of the audio clip to generate

steps.description: The number of steps to denoise the audio

reference_audio_url.description: Reference song, should contain music and vocals. Must be a .wav or .mp3 file longer than 15 seconds

purpose.description:
1. If purpose is song:
- You need to upload a music file containing both acapella (vocals) and accompaniment.
- The acapella must be in singing form; normal speech is not supported.
- Outputs: voice_id and instrumental_id.
2. If purpose is voice:
- You need to upload a file containing only acapella in singing form (normal speech audio is not supported).
- Output: voice_id.
3. If purpose is instrumental:
- You need to upload a file containing only accompaniment.
- Output: instrumental_id.

voice_id.description: The voice_id will only be returned when the purpose is song or voice.

instrumental_id.description: The instrumental_id will only be returned when the purpose is song or instrumental.

lyrics.example:
##Swift and Boundless 
 In the realm of innovation, where visions align, 

AIML API's the name, making tech shine. 
Intelligent solutions, breaking the mold, 

Swift inference power, bold and untold.
##

sample_rate.description: The sampling rate of the generated music

bitrate.description: The bit rate of the generated music

format.description: The format of the generated music

refer_voice.description: At least one of refer_voice or refer_instrumental is required. When only refer_voice is provided, the system can still output music data. The generated music will be an a cappella vocal hum that aligns with the provided refer_voice and the generated lyrics, without any instrumental accompaniment.

refer_instrumental.description: At least one of refer_voice or refer_instrumental is required. When only refer_instrumental is provided, the system can still output music data. The generated music will be a purely instrumental track that aligns with the provided refer_instrumental, without any vocals.

status.description: Music generation status. 1: In progress; 2: Completed.

audio.description: Hex-encoded audio data. Currently, can generate music with a duration of no more than 1 minute.

echo.description: If true, the new message will be prepended with the last message if they belong to the same role.

add_generation_prompt.description: If true, the generation prompt will be added to the chat template. This is a parameter used by chat template in tokenizer config of the model.

add_special_tokens.description: If true, special tokens (e.g. BOS) will be added to the prompt on top of what is added by the chat template. For most models, the chat template takes care of adding the special tokens so this should be set to False (as is the default).

documents.description: A list of dicts representing documents that will be accessible to the model if it is performing RAG (retrieval-augmented generation). If the template does not support RAG, this argument will have no effect. We recommend that each document should be a dict containing "title" and "text" keys.

chat_template.description: A Jinja template to use for this conversion. If this is not passed, the model's default chat template will be used instead.

chat_template_kwargs.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the template renderer. Will be accessible by the chat template

include_stop_str_in_output.description: Whether to include the stop string in the output. This is only applied when the stop or stop_token_ids is set

guided_json.description: If specified, the output will follow the JSON schema.

guided_regex.description: If specified, the output will follow the regex pattern.

guided_choice.description: If specified, the output will be exactly one of the choices.

guided_grammar.description: If specified, the output will follow the context free grammar.

guided_decoding_backend.description: If specified, will override the default guided decoding backend of the server for this specific request. If set, must be either 'outlines' / 'lm-format-enforcer'

guided_whitespace_pattern.description: If specified, will override the default whitespace pattern for guided json decoding.

ip.description: IP from which a request is executed

prompt.description: The text prompt for the image

convert_base64_to_url.description: If the condition is true, the url to the image will be returned; otherwise, the file will be provided in base64 format.

num_images.description: The number of images to generate

seed.description: The random seed for image generation

enhance_prompt.description: An optional parameter to use an LLM-based prompt rewriting feature to deliver higher quality images that better reflect the original prompt's intent. Disabling this feature may impact image quality and prompt adherence

aspect_ratio.description: The aspect ratio for the image

person_generation.description: Allow generation of people by the model

safety_setting.description: Adds a filter level to safety filtering

add_watermark.description: Add an invisible watermark to the generated images
